sensu auct. ( nec Rebel, 1929):

subSubSection.paragraph:
Adult ( Figure 7A ): Wingspan 13.0–16.0 mm. This species resembles
H. klimeschi Ponomarenko et Huemer
superficially. It can be distinguished from
H . klimeschi
by the valva with dorsal and ventral margins nearly parallel in the male genitalia ( Figure 11A ), the eighth tergite with wedge-shaped sclerotization on posterior margin in the female genitalia ( Figure 14A ); whereas in
H . klimeschi
, the dorsal margin of valva is projecting before apex in the male genitalia, the eighth tergite without wedge-shaped sclerotization in the female genitalia. In addition, the male eighth tergite is newly reported as follows: nearly heart-shaped, the anterior margin concave in an inverted trapezium, the lateral sides slightly concave, and the posterior margin rounded ( Figure 10A ).

CHINA : Henan Province : 1 female , Xiaguan , Neixiang County (
33 ◦ 02 ′ N

Figure 6.
Helcystogramma triannulella (Herrich-Schäffer)
. (A) Male genitalia, slide no. ZH06464; (B) female genitalia, slide no. ZH07156. (C) Male abdominal eighth tergite.

subSubSection.paragraph:
China ( Henan, Liaoning, Shaanxi, Sichuan, Zhejiang ), Russia
.

In
H. flavilineolella Ponomarenko
, the ventral surface of the abdomen is strongly sclerotized from abdominal support system to anterior margin of third segment, forming a sclerotized subrectangular plate that is longitudinally arched mesially and concave in a triangle or a semicircle posteriorly ( Figure 10R ). This species is newly reported for China .
